headline: Microsoft and OpenAI may be renegotiating their partnership
summary: OpenAI is currently in “a tough negotiation” with one of its biggest investors and partners, Microsoft, according to the Financial Times. The AI startup recently announced a major change to its corporate restructuring plans — while it still aims to convert its business arm into a for-profit public benefit corporation, its nonprofit board will remain in control. The FT says it spoke to multiple sources who describe Microsoft, which has invested $13 billion in OpenAI to date, as a key holdout need

raw.headline: Microsoft and OpenAI may be renegotiating their partnership

The AI startup recently announced a major change to its corporate restructuring plans — while it still aims to convert its business arm into a for-profit public benefit corporation, its nonprofit board will remain in control. The FT says it spoke to multiple sources who describe Microsoft, which has invested $13 billion in OpenAI to date, as a key holdout need

headline: OpenAI negotiates with Microsoft for new funding and future IPO, FT reports
summary: A critical issue is how much equity in OpenAI’s new for-profit business Microsoft will receive in exchange for the more than $13 billion it has invested in the company to date, the report said.  It said Microsoft is offering to give up some of its equity stake in exchange for access to new technology developed beyond the 2030 cutoff.  They are also revising terms of a wider contract, first drafted when Microsoft initially invested $1 billion into OpenAI in 2019, the report said.

headline: 3 Brilliant Nuclear Stocks to Buy Now and Hold for the Long Term
summary: Nuclear power is considered by many to be a reliable, clean energy source that can meet growing energy demand while reducing emissions.  Numerous countries have signed a pledge to triple nuclear production capacity by 2050.  The Trump administration is looking to fast-track the deployment of nuclear reactors in the U.S. The move comes as the sentiment around nuclear power shifts, and countries worldwide commit to ramping up their nuclear energy production.

headline: 2 Beaten-Down AI Stocks to Buy in May
summary: Advanced Micro Devices and C3.ai are two AI stocks that are trading at discounts and could be due for a rebound.  AMD's revenue surged 36% year over year last quarter, yet its stock trades at just 22 times this year's earnings estimate.  C3.ai could see accelerating demand for its AI software following partnerships with Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services.
